forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 58. Southwest wind around 9 mph.

forecast.name: Labor Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 72, with temperatures falling to around 70 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 8 to 17 mph.

weather_report:
As night softly blankets Downtown San Francisco, a refreshing coolness lingers in the air, marking a gentle transition into the early hours of September. The skies remain mostly clear, permitting the moonlight to dance over the cityscape, while a subtle southwest breeze whispers among the streets at about nine miles per hour. Overnight temperatures are expected to settle around the pleasantly mild 58 degrees, inviting a light jacket or a cozy sweater for those out enjoying the evening air.

Come Labor Day, the sun will rise to paint the horizon in vibrant hues of gold and blue, beckoning residents to welcome a splendid day ahead. The forecast nudges temperatures upward, hinting at a high near 72 degrees, friendly enough for outdoor ventures yet tempering to a cooler 70 by afternoon—ideal for a leisurely stroll through the park or perhaps a quiet moment at a café, pretending to read while delightful aromas waft from nearby kitchens. A gentle west-southwest breeze will accompany the daylight, enhancing the refreshing feel of the atmosphere. Though no fog or marine layer encumbers the brightened views, it may be wise to carry a light jacket for the afternoon coolness. Picture exploring local art galleries or perhaps indulging in a book by the bay, with the promise of an inviting, vibrant day unfolding before you.
